page.title: 09Crown Paints at Haltwhistle.
page.content: { Crown Paints}used to be called the Varnish Works because it made varnish, but that is made at Darwen now because a big fire burnt down the varnish kitchen. About 290 people work at Crown Paints. Scott, Karen and Michael's dads work in the factory making gloss, and emulsion paints and other special paints for blackboards, the bottom of ships, and other difficult surfaces. They work from 7.45am until 4.00pm. { Paint}is made by mixing dry powders called pigments (which give the paint its colours) with varnishes and solvents. The paint is mixed in high speed machines, put into tanks, then filled in tins by a special machine. The tins are taken to the warehouse, and waggons take it to Paint Shops. Some paint is put on freight liners and sent overseas to Saudi Arabia.
